Oxford Geek Nights #1

| 7:30pm

Keynotes

  • Simon Willison - An Introduction to OpenID (podcast) (slides as zip) (write-up)
  • Olly Willans - Demonstration of Photoshop CS3 (podcast)

Microslot set one

  • Tom Dyson - Peastat (podcast)
  • Jonathan Leighton - Ruby On Rails Migrations (podcast) (slides)
  • Tim Almond - Wordpress as a CMS (podcast) (slides) (write-up)
  • Gemma Hentsch - Concatenating forms, a Django extension (podcast) (slides)
  • Garrett Coakley - Drupal 5 (podcast) (slides) (write-up)
  • JP Stacey - Building an ultra thin CMS with XSL and Atom (podcast) (slides) (write-up)

Microslot set two

  • Nick Burch - New Popular Edition Maps (podcast)
  • Artem Pavlenko - Mapnik, a map rendering engine (podcast) (slides)
  • Matthew Westcott - London Underground Tube map demonstration (podcast)
  • Bryan Gullan - Avoiding accessibility pitfalls (podcast) (slides) (write-up)
  • James Wheare - Live Bus Times, a Google maps mashup (podcast) (write-up)

Join the mailing list

Oxford Geek Night is a regular meet-up for designers & developers run by Torchbox

We have two keynote talks of 15 minutes each followed by a handful of 5 minute micro-slots.

Want to be speaker? Get in Touch
